Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-02-04T18:08:02Describing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Federation of Shorthand Reporters Records
Federation of Shorthand Reporters
WAG.193
1 linear foot in 1 record carton.
1968-1986 The Federation of Shorthand Reporters consists of members who do stenographic reporting for law firms in New York City. The Federation of Shorthand Reporters Records date from 1968 to 1986 and contain contracts, correspondence, clippings, and legal filings that document the union's strikes, resolved grievances, arbitration, association with District Council 1707, and general membership. Materials are in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access. 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.181.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical Note
The Federation of Shorthand Reporters consists of members who do stenographic reporting for law firms in New York City.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Federation of Shorthand Reporters Records; WAG 193; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders and described at the collection level.
Scope and Contents
The Federation of Shorthand Reporters Records date from 1968 to 1986 and contain contracts, correspondence, clippings, and legal filings that document the union's strikes, resolved grievances, association with District Council 1707, and general membership. Strikes in 1968, 1980, and 1986 are well documented with clippings, correspondence, and internal notes. A large portion of the collection consists of files from legal counsel representing the union in arbitrations and an anti-trust case. Files on the union's Ad Hoc Computer Committee are also included.
Conditions Governing Use
The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1968-1986, are expected to enter the public domain in 2107.
Law reporters -- Labor unions Law reporting -- New York (State) -- New York Labor unions -- Organizing -- New York (State) -- New York. Contracts. Grievance arbitration.
